article_title: Bill Waiving Insurance Rules for Midsize Businesses Clears Senate
article_text:
WASHINGTON—A bill waiving the federal health law’s insurance rules for tens of thousands of midsize businesses cleared the Senate Thursday in a rare example of congressional agreement to undo part of the 2010 Affordable Care Act.

The legislation had already passed the House, and the White House appears open to signing it.

The Senate used a fast-track process that avoided an up-or-down vote on the measure, which would free...
